{{also|Sie|≈°ie|siƒô|si'e}} ==English== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|en|enm|sien}}, from {{inh|en|ang|sƒ´gan||to sink, descend}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*sƒ´ganƒÖ}}, {{m|gem-pro|*sƒ´hwanƒÖ||to strain, drop}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*seyk-||to pour, strain}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|zijgen||to filter}}, {{cog|de|seihen||to strain, sieve}}, {{cog|is|s√≠ga||to lower}}. ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|sigh}} * {{l|en|sey}}, {{l|en|sye}} {{qualifier|Scotland}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|en|/sa…™/}} * {{rhymes|en|a…™}} ====Verb==== {{en-verb|sies|sying|sied}} # {{lb|en|intransitive}} To [[sink]]; [[fall]]; [[drop]]. # {{lb|en|intransitive}} To fall, as in a [[swoon]]; [[faint]]. # {{lb|en|intransitive|dialectal}} To drop, as water; [[trickle]]. # {{lb|en|transitive}} To [[sift]]. # {{lb|en|transitive|dialectal}} To [[strain]], as milk; [[filter]]. ====Noun==== {{en-noun}} # A [[drop]]. =====Related terms===== * {{l|en|sile}} ===Etymology 2=== ====Pronunciation==== * {{homophones|en|c|cee|sea|see}} definition|[[gender-neutral|Gender-neutral]] subject pronoun, grammatically equivalent to the gendered pronouns [[he]] and [[she]]}} #* '''1993''' September 24, Alex Martelli, "punishment vs ethics (was Re: Discipline my daughters)", in alt.sex.bondage, ''Usenet'': #*: If the child is about the intellectual equal of the parent, '''sie''' will eventually start holding hir own in discussions, ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|fi|a=eis|eis|esi-|ies|sei}} [[Category:Finnish personal pronouns]] ---- ==German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|de|se}}, {{l|de|-se}} {{qual|enclitic; colloquial}} ===Pronunciation=== * {{qualifier|standard}} {{IPA|de|/ziÀê/}} :* {{audio|de|De-sie.ogg|audio}} :* {{rhymes|de|iÀê}} * {{qualifier|colloquially in unstressed position}} {{IPA|de|/z…ô/}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|goh|siu}}. Cognate with {{cog|got|êçÉêåπ}} and {{cog|ang|sƒìo||that one (f.)}}. ====Pronoun==== {{head|de|pronoun|cat2=personal pronouns|g=f}} # [[she]] #: {{ux|de|Ist '''sie''' noch krank?|t=Is '''she''' still sick?}} #: {{ux|de|Das ist meine Katze. '''Sie''' hei√üt Lili.|t=This is my cat. '''Her''' name is Lili.}} # [[it]] (when the object/article/thing/animal etc., referred to, is feminine ({{m|de|die}})) #: {{ux|de|Scheint die Sonne noch? Nein, '''sie''' ist schon runtergegangen.|t=Is the Sun still shining? No, '''it''' has already gone down.}} =====Inflection===== {{de-decl-personal pronouns}} * The genitive case {{m|de|ihrer}} is more and more rarely used in modern German. * While the genitive of personal pronouns does express ownership, it must not be confused with possessive pronouns. While possessive pronouns such as {{m|de|ihr}} are put in front of the noun they relate to and follow the inflection rules of adjectives, the genitive form of personal pronouns has only one form, which is not further inflected. Additionally, personal pronouns in the genitive can be put after the word they relate to. =====Related terms===== * {{l|de|hatse}} ({{l|de|haben|hat}} + {{l|de|-se}}) ===Etymology 2=== From {{inh|de|goh|sie}} (masculine plural), {{m|goh|sio}} (feminine plural), {{m|goh|siu}} (neuter plural). ====Pronoun==== {{head|de|pronoun|cat2=personal pronouns|g=p}} # [[they]]; [[them]] =====Inflection===== {{de-decl-personal pronouns}} ====Usage notes==== * In the colloquial speech of some areas, this pronoun is used only enclitically after a verb, as an ending /z…ô/. E.g. ''hamse'', ''k√∂nnse''. Stressed instances are replaced with the demonstrative pronoun {{m|de|die}}. This reflects a similar development for {{m|de|es}}/{{m|de|das}}. * While the genitive of personal pronouns does express ownership, it must not be confused with possessive pronouns. While possessive pronouns such as {{m|de|ihr}} are put in front of the noun they relate to and follow the inflection rules of adjectives, the genitive form of a personal pronoun has only one form, which is not further inflected. Additionally, personal pronouns in the genitive can be put after the word they relate to. ===Anagrams=== * {{l|de|sei}} * {{l|de|Eis}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Hunsrik== ===Alternative forms=== * {{l|hrx|sii}} (Wiesemann spelling system) ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|hrx|goh|siu}};
